page.title: 04LOWER BOWDEN FARM 1
page.content: Lower Bowden Farm which is 1064 acres in size, is a dairy and arable farm. The owners have lived there for 23 years. Lower Bowden's 368 acres are used to grow maize in 46 acres, winter barley in 28 acres, winter wheat in 39 acres and grass in 171 acres; the rest are woods, tracks and a nursery. Similarly College Farm is 130 acres in size, of which 24 acres are used for growing winter wheat, 55 acres for winter barley, 30 acres for triticale and 21 acres for grass. There is also some rented land away from the farm. Basildon Park's 180 acres are entirely grass; Golden Farm is 123 acres comprising of 95 acres of winter wheat and 28 acres winter beans; Scrace's Farm is 129 acres in size made up of 64 acres of winter wheat, 25 acres of winter barley and 40 acres of grass,
